title: Finca Las Mercedes, Edgar Ossa
description: Finca Las Mercedes, located in southern Huila, has become increasingly recognized over the past ten years for its quality. Don Heladio is a pioneer among producers and continuously experiments to produce even more vibrant coffees year after year.

title: Finca Salomé, Salomé Guzman
description: This is a multigenerational family operation. Salomé's grandkids accompany their parents to the farm and spend time playing among the coffee trees and eating wild strawberries during visits. Salomé has some of the oldest Bourbon trees planted in the area.

title: Bochessa, Sidama
description: In the highlands of Arbegona, coffee is a way of life. Grown on small, shaded farms and delivered by motorbike or mule, this coffee is the product of over 800 dedicated producers. The result is a vibrant, fruited coffee with lush citrus notes and a long-lasting floral finish.

title: Finca La Guitarra, Renardo Ovalle
description: We've worked with Renardo Ovalle since 2017 and have consistently been impressed with the quality of his coffees and dedication to working with more varieties on his farms. The same year that we first started sourcing from another of his farms, he acquired Finca La Guitarra. It is named for the lianas, woody vines found in heavily forested tropical areas, that are suspended all over the canopy and resemble guitar strings. Finca La Guitarra is tucked away in a steep valley surrounded by steep mountains and is planted with mostly San Ramon and Caturra trees. San Ramon is a dwarf descendant of Typica and produces less fruit when compared to other coffees with Typica lineages.

title: Finca Zulema, Norma Erazo, Honey Processed
description: A honey-processed coffee from Finca Zulema, showcasing bright fruity notes balanced with rich chocolate undertones. Norma Erazo's careful processing highlights the unique character of the beans grown in Honduras.

title: Nueva Esperanza, David Muñoz
description: One of the highest quality and most consistent coffees we source annually. David Muñoz passes down the love of coffee to his sons, teaching them to produce coffee on their own farm. Somehow, this coffee gets better every year.

title: Rianjagi AA
description: Established in 1976, the Rianjagi Factory is owned by the cooperative members who deliver coffee to the washing station. The cooperative oversees farmer training that helps produce consistently excellent coffee and provides farmers with higher prices for their annual harvest. This is a great representation of a classic Kenyan coffee - a densely sweet body that shines with tropical fruit flavors.

title: Owl's Howl
profiles: Cacao Nib, Stone Fruit, Candied Orange Peel
description: Sightglass' flagship espresso blend delivers consistent balance and depth, crafted from seasonal coffees sourced for optimal freshness.

title: Blueboon
description: This well-balanced, versatile blend celebrates simple, approachable flavors of milk chocolate, citrus, and stone fruits. We change the components seasonally, so the coffees are always fresh and the balance of sweetness, body, and acidity is just right.
